column1: Appification of the web
column2: The First Workshop on Appification of the Web will be held on April 16, 2012, in Lyon, France, in conjunction with the 21st World Wide Web Conference (WWW 2012). The workshop will bring together researchers and practitioners from industry and academia to discuss the impact of mobile apps on the Web search and browsing paradigms.

column1: Data Usage Management on the web
column2: The current abundance of digital data requires societal, legal, economical, and technical approaches to ensure appropriate use of this vast amount of data. Following two successful events - the Dagstuhl Seminar onÊDistributed Usage ControlÊand theÊW3C Privacy and Data Usage Control Workshop, the goal of this workshop is to discuss current developments in usage management and to identify interesting areas of future research

column1: HCI, web and Graphics curricula at the Crossroads of Science, Design and Technology
column2: The objective of this workshop is to coordinate the community of practice as we share scholarly insights into the learning outcomes of the relevant domains and into the relationships between these outcomes.

column1: LDOW 2012 : linked Data on the web
column2: The Web is continuing to develop from a medium for publishing textual documents into a medium for sharing structured data. In 2011, the Web of Linked Data grew to a size of about 32 billion RDF triples, with contributions coming increasingly from companies, governments and other public sector bodies such as libraries, statistical bodies or environmental agencies

column1: LSNA : Large Scale Network Analysis
column2: Large network data are being produced by various applications in an ever growing rate, from social networks such as Facebook and Twitter, scientific citation networks such as CiteSeerX, to biological networks such as protein interaction networks

column1: MSM 2012 : Making Sense of Microposts
column2: With the appearance and expansion of Twitter, Facebook Like, Foursquare, and similar low-effort publishing services, the effort required to participate on the Web is getting lower and lower

column1: Multi-A pro : International Workshop on interoperabiliy of users
column2: Gather researchers from the industrial and academic communities and organize a discussion around challenges in multi-application user modeling and personalization, such as interoperability, semantic approaches, social applications, privacy, and context-awareness, and on how to further direct and capitalize on the relevant ongoing research efforts on the Web

column1: SMANE 2012 : Intl. Workshop on Social Media Applications in News and Entertainment
column2: The aim of this workshop is to encourage discussion and sharing of ideas and research results on social media research, techniques, and applications, in two crucial areas: News and Entertainment

column1: The Anti-Social Web : Credibility and Quality Issues on the Web and Social Media (WebQuality 2012)
column2: The objective of the workshop is to provide the research communities working on web spam, abuse, credibility, and reputation topics with a survey of current problems and potential solutions

column1: WI&C : Web Intellignece & Communities
column2: Web Intelligence consists of a multidisciplinary area dealing with exploiting data and services over the Web, to create new data and services using both Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniques. Communities appear as a first-class object in the areas of web intelligence and agent technologies, as well as a crucial crossroads of several sub-domains

column1: WS-REST 2012 : Third international Workshop on RESTful Design
column2: The Third International Workshop on RESTful Design (WS-REST 2012) aims to provide a forum for discussion and dissemination of research on the emerging resource-oriented style of Web service design.

column1: Community Question answering on the Web
column2: In spite of the continuous progress of Web search engines in the last 20 years, many users' needs still remain unanswered

column1: USEWOD 2012 : 2nd on Usage Analysis and the Web of Data
column2: The purpose of this workshop is to investigate new developments concerning the synergy between semantics and semantic-web technology on the one hand, and the analysis and mining of usage data on the other hand

column1: Emerging Web Technologies, Facing the Future of Education
column2: The Net Generation, Y Generation, C Generation, digital natives... there are many terms Ð several controversial - used to name youth who were born into a world where the Internet is of great importance

column1: Messaging and Web of Data : Private meets Public (and vice-versa)
column2: The growing amount of public available data on the WWW is a new opportunity to improve Messaging systems (e.g. Email, Social Media, Instant Messaging) in multiple forms, such as messages content, processing (classification, etc.) and presentation

column1: MSND : Workshop on Mining Social Networks Dynamics
column2: MSND aims at gathering researchers from the fields of social computing, machine learning, and data mining to think about the obstacles that hurdle the leveraging of understanding and capturing of social network dynamics

column1: SIMPLEX : Simplifying Complex Networks for Practitioners
column2: Network science, sometimes also called "complex networks science", has recently attracted much attention from the scientific community, mainly due to the almost ubiquitous presence of complex networks in real-world systems

column1: DiversiWeb 2012
column2: We aim to address a wide array of interdisciplinary questions around knowledge diversity on the Web, which need to be tackled in order to preserve the fragile balance between a world that is continually converging and growing together, the rich diversity of the global society, and the dangers of fragmentation and splintering

column1: TempWeb : Second Temporal Web Analytics Workshop
column2: The objective of this workshop is to provide a venue for researchers of all domains (IE/IR, Web mining etc.) where the temporal dimension opens up an entirely new range of challenges and possibilities

column1: Dec3D2012 : Declarative 3D for the  Architecture
column2: The aim of the workshop is to encourage researchers from both the Web and 3D graphics communities to meet and talk about an integration of interactive 3D graphics capabilities into the Web technology stack

column1: Linked Learning 2012 : 2nd International Workshop on Learning and Education with the  of Data
column2: This workshop will provide a forum to discuss approaches making use of Web Data resources and technologies, especiallyÊLinked Data, for teaching, learning and education.Ê

column1: AdMIRE 2012 : The Web of Music Ð 4th Workshop on Advances in Music Information Research
column2: TheÊInternational Workshop on Advances in Music Information Research (AdMIRe)Êserves as a forum for theoretical and practical discussions of cutting edge research on Web technologies for music information research

column1: SWCS : Semantic Web Collaborative Spaces
column2: Semantic Web Collaborative Spaces such as semantic wikis, semantic social networks,Êsemantic forums, etc. are social semantic software with the mission to bring together humanÊagents and software agents in order to foster knowledge-intensive collaboration, contentÊcreation and management, annotated multimedia collection management, social knowledgeÊdiffusion and formalising, and more generally speaking ontology-oriented content managementÊlife-cycle.

column1: CrowdSearch : Crowdsourcing  Web search
column2: Link analysis, that has shaped Web search technology in the last decade, can be seen as a massive mining of crowd-secured reputation associated with pages

column1: WAC7: ACL SIG on Web as Corpus
column2: More and more people are using Web data for linguistic and NLP research: the Web provides an easy source of linguistic data in a great variety of languages. However, a ÔcrawlÕ is not ready for exploration in the same way a traditional ÔcorpusÕ is. We need to turn a crawl into a corpus

column1: PSOSM : Workshop on Privacy and Security in Online Social Media
column2: With increase in usage of the Internet, there has been an exponential increase in the use of online social media on the Internet. Websites like Facebook, YouTube, Orkut, Twitter and Flickr have changed the way Internet is being used

column1: Xperience Web : Reasonning from Experiences on the Web
column2: Advances in web technology has led to vast amounts of user generated web content in the form of blogs, reviews, opinions and social media interactions. Increasingly people search, browse and interact with other people and their experiences on travel, medicine, retail, entertainment etc for their informational and problem solving needs

column1: W3C : CSS3
column2: The goal of the tutorial is to explain the newest features of Cascading Style Sheets (CSS)

column1: W3C : Accessibility in tomorow's Web
column2: Accessibility is essential for developers and organizations who want to create high quality websites and web tools, and not exclude people from using your online resources

column1: The role of human-generated and automatically extracted lexico-semantic ressources in Web
column2: This tutorial examines the role of knowledge from lexico-semantic resources, whether human-generated or automatically-extracted, in information retrieval in general, and Web search in particular

column1: Large Scale Machine Learning and its Application to Web Information Management
column2: Machine learning techniques have been widely used in web information management, such as document retrieval, text categorization, web page clustering, and social network analysis

column1: Watson and the Deep QA architecture
column2: Open domain Question Answering (QA) is a long standing research problem. Recently, IBM took on this challenge in the context of Jeopardy!, a well-known TV quiz show that has been airing on television in the United States for more than 25 years

column1: W3C : HTML 5
column2: The tutorial will present the main characteristics of HTML5

column1: Enhancing Search Relevance : Machine Learning Techniques for Better Matching of Query and Document
column2: In this tutorial, we will give a systematic and detailed presentation on newly developed machine learning technologies for query document matching in search

column1: W3C : Developing Mobile Web Applications
column2: Participants to the tutorial will learn how to build applications for mobile devices using Web technologies

column1: Location-Based Social Networks
column2: In this tutorial, we first introduce and define the meaning of location-based social network (LBSN)

column1: Mining, Searching and Exploiting Collaboratively Generated Content on the Web
column2: Proliferation of ubiquitous access to the Internet enables millions of Web users to collaborate online on a variety of activities

column1: Practical Cross-Dataset Queries on the Web of Data
column2: The web is developing into a platform for data exchange, as shown by the rise of web APIs, Microdata, Schema.org, FacebookÕs Open Graph Protocol, and the Linked Open Data Cloud

column1: Querying and Exchanging XML and RDF on the Web
column2: This tutorial is intended to benet researchers and system designers in the broad area of scalable query engines for XML and RDF

column1: Integrating and Ranking Aggregated Content on the Web
column2: In this tutorial, we will present the core problems associated with content aggregation, which include: sources of predictive evidence, sources of training data, relevance modelling, and evaluation

column1: The Web of Things
column2: The tutorial on Web of Things will discuss the vertical of the system by identifying the relevant components, illustrating their functionality and showing existing tools and systems

column1: Digital Advertising and Marketing: A review of three generations
column2: Over the past 15 years online advertising, a $65 billion industry worldwide in 2010, has been pivotal to the success of the World Wide Web

column1: W3C Tutorial: Open Data in Practice
column2: This tutorial aims to help participants understand that breadth and potential of government open data. It also will give them an appreciation for the complications of dealing with this data from a variety of organisations in varying formats and levels of quality
